meta.script: {"@context":"https://schema.org","@graph":[{"@type":"Organization","@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#organization","name":"The Trevor Project","url":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/","sameAs":["https://www.facebook.com/TheTrevorProject/","https://www.instagram.com/trevorproject/","https://www.linkedin.com/company/86888/","https://www.youtube.com/thetrevorproject","https://www.pinterest.com/trevorproject/","https://twitter.com/trevorproject"],"logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#logo","inLanguage":"en-US","url":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/TheTrevorProjectwLGBTQTag_COLOR.png","width":1626,"height":640,"caption":"The Trevor Project"},"image":{"@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#logo"}},{"@type":"WebSite","@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#website","url":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/","name":"The Trevor Project","inLanguage":"en-US","description":"Saving Young LGBTQ Lives","publisher":{"@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#organization"},"potentialAction":{"@type":"SearchAction","target":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/?s={search_term_string}","query-input":"required name=search_term_string"}},{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/get-help-now/#webpage","url":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/get-help-now/","name":"Get Help Now – The Trevor Project","isPartOf":{"@id":"https://www.thetrevorproject.org/#website"},"inLanguage":"en-US","datePublished":"2017-08-09T00:56:41+00:00","dateModified":"2019-07-30T15:09:27+00:00"}]}

body.class: page-template-default page page-id-112 page-parent mega-menu-top-bar-r mega-menu-mobile-nav offcanvas

div.p: Need help? We are here for you 24/7:

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-current-menu-item mega-page_item mega-page-item-112 mega-current_page_item mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1699

div.p: If you’re thinking about suicide, you deserve immediate help - please call the Trevor Lifeline at 866-488-7386.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-widget widget_nav_menu mega-menu-columns-1-of-2 mega-menu-clear mega-menu-item-nav_menu-2
menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-menu-item page_item page-item-112 current_page_item menu-item-2395

mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1700

div.p: The Lifeguard Workshop is a free online learning module with a video, curriculum, and teacher resources for middle school and high school classrooms.

The Trevor Project’s Trainings for Professionals include in-person Ally and CARE trainings designed for adults who work with youth. These trainings help counselors, educators, administrators, school nurses, and social workers discuss LGBTQ-competent suicide prevention.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1701

div.p: Access information preventing suicide and Trevor’s unique resources for LGBTQ youth.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1702

div.p: Want to get involved with The Trevor Project’s life-saving work but don’t know where to start?
Click on these volunteering opportunities to explore how you can help end suicide among LGBTQ youth.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1703

div.p: Founded in 1998 by the creators of the Academy Award®-winning short film TREVOR, The Trevor Project is the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer & questioning (LGBTQ) young people under 25.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1704

div.p: Welcome to our blog and events section! Find out the current stories, and learn about our upcoming events.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-2359

div.p: As a 501(c)3 non-profit, The Trevor Project relies on the generosity of friends to ensure that lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning (LGBTQ) youth have a safe place to turn in times of crisis.
Click here to make a gift by mail.
Donor Privacy Policy. ☆☆☆☆ Charity Navigator Rated.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-current-menu-item mega-page_item mega-page-item-112 mega-current_page_item mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1699

div.p: If you’re thinking about suicide, you deserve immediate help - please call the Trevor Lifeline at 866-488-7386.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-widget widget_nav_menu mega-menu-columns-1-of-2 mega-menu-clear mega-menu-item-nav_menu-2
menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-menu-item page_item page-item-112 current_page_item menu-item-2395

mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1700

div.p: The Lifeguard Workshop is a free online learning module with a video, curriculum, and teacher resources for middle school and high school classrooms.

The Trevor Project’s Trainings for Professionals include in-person Ally and CARE trainings designed for adults who work with youth. These trainings help counselors, educators, administrators, school nurses, and social workers discuss LGBTQ-competent suicide prevention.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1701

div.p: Access information preventing suicide and Trevor’s unique resources for LGBTQ youth.

div.p: Want to get involved with The Trevor Project’s life-saving work but don’t know where to start?
Click on these volunteering opportunities to explore how you can help end suicide among LGBTQ youth.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1703

div.p: Founded in 1998 by the creators of the Academy Award®-winning short film TREVOR, The Trevor Project is the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer & questioning (LGBTQ) young people under 25.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-1704

div.p: Welcome to our blog and events section! Find out the current stories, and learn about our upcoming events.

li.class: mega-menu-item mega-menu-item-type-post_type mega-menu-item-object-page mega-menu-megamenu mega-menu-item-has-children mega-align-bottom-left mega-menu-megamenu mega-hide-arrow mega-hide-sub-menu-on-mobile mega-menu-item-2359

div.p: As a 501(c)3 non-profit, The Trevor Project relies on the generosity of friends to ensure that lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning (LGBTQ) youth have a safe place to turn in times of crisis.
Click here to make a gift by mail.
Donor Privacy Policy. ☆☆☆☆ Charity Navigator Rated.

TrevorText will be unavailable April 22 from 7am – 11am ET (4am – 8am PT) due to scheduled maintenance.
If you need assistance please use TrevorChat or call the TrevorLifeline at 1-866-488-7386.

article.class: main-content post-112 page type-page status-publish hentry

p.br: If you are thinking about suicide and in need of immediate support, please call the TrevorLifeline at 1-866-488-7386 or select TrevorChat below to connect with a counselor.

div.p: TrevorLifeline is a crisis intervention and suicide prevention phone service available 24/7/365.
Confidential online instant messaging with a Trevor counselor, available 24/7.

small.em: Access through a computer, as you may have technical difficulties if using a smartphone or tablet.

div.p: Confidential text messaging with a Trevor counselor, available 24/7/365.
TrevorSpace — An online international peer-to-peer community for LGBTQ young people and their friends.
Trevor Support Center — Where LGBTQ youth and allies can find answers to FAQs and explore resources related to sexual orientation, gender identity and more.

img.alt: The Trevor Project; Saving Young LGBTQ Lives

div.p: The Trevor Project is the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer & questioning youth.
